titleStmt.title: The compleat soldier, or expert artillery-man Containing the several postures and exercises of the pike and musquet; the various beats of the drum; and what else is necessary for a young soldier to understand. Also, divers ways of exercising a company, very useful for all officers, and others, that delight in military affairs.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by A. G. and J. P. for Thomas Sawbridge, at the Three Flowers-de-Lys in Little-Britain,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
